revised_title: Kolmogorov's Two-Equation Model of Turbulence: A Pioneering Contribution
tldr: This article discusses A. N. Kolmogorov's pioneering two-equation model of turbulence, which he proposed in 1941. The model uses two variables, fluctuation energy and frequency notation, to predict turbulent flow. The author highlights the similarities and differences between Kolmogorov's model and later models, emphasizing its importance in the field of turbulence modeling.
